stories.text:
I have talked to several people who struggle to figure out which tax deadlines apply to them and their entities, particularly when they have multiple entities. It takes away from peace of mind and makes them worried they'll get fined.

Is there a good solution to this, other than talking to multiple accountants? I've been thinking about creating a solution that uses CPA-validated tax deadlines and software to help business-owners track deadlines, and customize it to use a users' specific entity types. I would consult with multiple CPAs to make sense of the conflicting info for different entities, then create a software program that sends reminders based on a user's specific type.

Do you think this would be useful? Does something like this exist?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you manage LLC tax deadlines (especially if you own 1 org)

stories.text:
We received a notice that our domain (registered with https://domains.google/) will be suspended in 72 hours due to a spam complaint. After replying with multiple emails demonstrating our innocence, we have yet to receive any feedback on this issue. Truth is, out of 205,169 emails sent, only 15 of them were marked as spam.

Now we have less than 42 hours to resolve this issue. Failing that, our website will be cut off from more than 500,000 community members worldwide.

Could you please help us resolve this issue? This has truly been the most stressful time in the company's history.
stories.title: Ask HN: Suspended by Google Domain
